p: Vitamin B 12 is synthesized exclusively by microorganisms. Animals acquire this vitamin through the grass, where the bacteria responsible for synthesizing B 12 live, or by B 12 fortified feed. In contrast, only a few algae and mushrooms contain vitamin B 12, thus, making plant-based diets inadequate. Several studies have reported lower vitamin B 12 status in vegetarians, both lacto-ovo-vegetarians and vegans, compared to omnivorous [ 69, 74, 75, 76]. Other studies showed a tendency to higher deficiency risk in vegans compared to lacto-ovo-vegetarians, even though the contribution of dairy and eggs to the total dietary vitamin B 12 is small in such diets [ 69, 86]. Therefore, plant-based diet consumers must ingest B 12-fortified foods or B 12 supplements to prevent deficiency.
